intro: Dilophotriche pobeguinii, commonly known as the Pobeguin's spider orchid, is a rare and specialized orchid species native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its unique floral structure, which includes a distinctive two-lobed labellum. The plant typically grows in humid, shaded environments, often in rocky or forested areas. Its flowers are usually small and pale, with intricate patterns that aid in pollination by specific insect species. Due to habitat loss and limited distribution, it is considered endangered and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
